docComment:
/**
 * Entry point exporting the ListDisplay React components, core hook, data source helpers, and supporting TypeScript types.
 *
 * @packageDocumentation
 */
name: @liquidrazor/list-display

members.docComment:
/**
 * Base context object provided to all action handlers, containing the current list state and mutation methods.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: ActionContextBase
exportState
filters
pagination
refresh
rows
selection
sort
updateRows
visibleRows

members.docComment:
/**
 * Visual style variants available for list actions.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: ActionKind

members.docComment:
/**
 * Active filters at list level. Keyed by field id (or custom logical id).
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * Maps field identifiers to their current filter values. The structure of each value depends on the filter type and operator being used.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: ActiveFilterState

members.docComment:
/**
 * Context object passed to custom cell renderers.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: CellRenderContext
isSelected
rowIndex

members.docComment:
/**
 * Renders a confirmation modal dialog with customizable content and actions.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * This component provides a very small, unstyled confirm modal. Styling is left to consumer via CSS classes. The modal includes a header, optional body content, and footer with cancel and confirm action buttons.
 *
 * @param props - The component props
 *
 * @returns A modal dialog element with backdrop
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: ConfirmModal

members.docComment:
/**
 * Configuration for the built-in confirmation modal used by actions that need a simple yes/no flow.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: ConfirmModalConfig
cancelLabel
confirmLabel
description
title
type

members.docComment:
/**
 * Props for the ConfirmModal component.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: ConfirmModalProps
cancelLabel
confirmLabel
description
onCancel
onConfirm
title

members.docComment:
/**
 * Creates a query-based data source with single-shot load and optional refresh capability.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * This function creates a DataSource implementation that loads data using a provided query function. The data source supports initialization and refresh operations, making it suitable for list views that need to fetch and reload data.
 *
 * @param options - Configuration options for the query source
 *
 * @typeParam TRow - The type of individual row objects in the result set
 *
 * @typeParam TRowId - The type used for row identifiers (extends RowId)
 *
 * @returns A DataSource object with query-based loading capabilities
 *
 * @example
 * ```typescript
 * const userSource = createQuerySource({
 *   load: async () => {
 *     const response = await fetch('/api/users');
 *     const data = await response.json();
 *     return { rows: data.users, totalCount: data.total };
 *   },
 *   label: 'User List'
 * });
 * ```
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: createQuerySource

members.docComment:
/**
 * Creates a simple, static data source that returns an initial snapshot of rows without streaming updates or patches.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * This data source is ideal for static lists where data does not change after initialization. It provides all rows upfront during the `init` call and does not support real-time updates.
 *
 * @param options - Configuration options for the static data source
 *
 * @typeParam TRow - The type of row objects in the data source
 *
 * @typeParam TRowId - The type of row identifiers (defaults to RowId)
 *
 * @returns A DataSource instance configured with the provided static data
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: createStaticSource

members.docComment:
/**
 * Creates a streaming data source for real-time data updates.
 *
 * Supports various streaming protocols including Server-Sent Events (SSE), WebSockets, RTSK, NDJSON, and other push-based data delivery mechanisms. The source can optionally bootstrap with initial data and continuously receive updates via patches.
 *
 * @param options - Configuration options for the streaming data source
 *
 * @typeParam TRow - The type of row objects in the data source
 *
 * @typeParam TRowId - The type of row identifiers, defaults to string | number
 *
 * @returns A DataSource object that manages the streaming connection and data updates
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: createStreamSource

members.docComment:
/**
 * Configuration for a user-supplied modal renderer, allowing bespoke flows while still participating in the ListDisplay action lifecycle.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: CustomModalConfig
render
type
CustomModalRenderContext
close
submit

members.docComment:
/**
 * Discriminated union representing incremental data updates that can be applied to the list. - `replaceAll`: Replace all rows with a new set - `append`: Add a single new row - `update`: Update an existing row - `remove`: Remove a row by ID
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: DataPatch
DataPatchListener

members.docComment:
/**
 * Generic, technology-agnostic data source contract. Wraps parent-provided data, streams, queries etc. This interface abstracts away the underlying data fetching mechanism, allowing the list component to work with static data, real-time streams, REST APIs, GraphQL queries, and more.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: DataSource
destroy
init
meta
refresh
subscribe

members.docComment:
/**
 * Result object returned by the data source's initial load operation.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: DataSourceInitResult
rows
status
totalCount

members.docComment:
/**
 * Defines the kind of data source being used. - `static`: Fixed data provided once at initialization - `stream`: Real-time data that can push updates incrementally - `query`: Data fetched from a query-based source (e.g., REST API, GraphQL)
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: DataSourceKind

members.docComment:
/**
 * Metadata describing a data source's characteristics.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: DataSourceMeta
kind
label

members.docComment:
/**
 * Text alignment options for field cells and headers.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: FieldAlign

members.docComment:
/**
 * Per-field filter configuration.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * Defines how a specific field should be filtered, including the filter type, available operators, normalization logic, and predefined options.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: FieldFilterConfig

members.docComment:
/**
 * Normalizes a raw value from the row into something that can be used for generic filtering / searching.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * Used to transform complex field values into filterable primitives. For example, converting a date object to a timestamp or extracting a nested property value.
 *
 * @param value - The raw field value from the row
 *
 * @param row - The complete row object for context
 *
 * @returns The normalized value suitable for filtering
 */

excerptTokens.text: (value: TValue, row: TRow) => string | number | boolean | null

members.name: normalize
operators

members.docComment:
/**
 * Optional list of static options (for select / multiSelect).
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * When provided, these options will be presented to the user for selection. Each option contains a value and a human-readable label. {@link FilterOption}
 */
members.name: options
type

members.docComment:
/**
 * Column/field definition for the list, describing how a field should be displayed and behave.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: FieldSchema
align
cellRenderer
cellStyle
filter
headerStyle
id
label
minWidth
sortable
width

members.docComment:
/**
 * Operators supported by the filtering engine.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * Includes comparison operators (equals, notEquals, gt, gte, lt, lte, between), text operators (contains, startsWith, endsWith), and set operators (in).
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: FilterOperator

members.docComment:
/**
 * Option used by select-based filters.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * Used by select and multiSelect filter types to provide predefined choices.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: FilterOption
label
value

members.docComment:
/**
 * Props for the filters panel slot. This component is expected to surface controls for adjusting the active filter set.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: FiltersPanelProps
fields
onChangeFilters
state

members.docComment:
/**
 * Logical filter types used to match operators and value shapes.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * Determines which operators are available and how filter values are interpreted. Custom types allow for specialized filtering logic.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: FilterType

members.docComment:
/**
 * Action that operates on the entire list or selected rows, not tied to a specific row.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: GeneralAction
handler
requiresSelection
GeneralActionContext

members.docComment:
/**
 * Base interface for all list actions, defining common properties like label, icon, and modal configuration.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: ListActionBase
icon
id
kind
label
modal
opensModal

members.docComment:
/**
 * Mapping of overridable UI components ("slots"). Relaxed typing here since you control any overrides.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: ListComponents
EmptyState
ErrorState
FiltersPanel
LoadingState
ModalOutlet
Pagination
SortBar
Table
Toolbar

members.docComment:
/**
 * Optional props bag for slot components keyed by the slot name. This allows consumers to feed ad-hoc properties into overridden components while keeping the core library agnostic of their shape.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: ListComponentsProps

members.docComment:
/**
 * Public configuration accepted by ListDisplay component.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * This interface defines all configuration options for creating a ListDisplay instance, including data source, field definitions, actions, filtering, sorting, pagination, selection behavior, and UI component customization.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: ListConfig

members.docComment:
/**
 * Overridable UI components (slots) for customizing the list appearance.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * Allows replacement of default UI components with custom implementations for various parts of the list, such as the toolbar, filters, pagination controls, etc. {@link ListComponents}
 */
members.name: components

members.docComment:
/**
 * Optional props passed to slot components for additional customization.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * Provides a way to pass additional configuration or props to the custom components specified in the components property. {@link ListComponentsProps}
 */
members.name: componentsProps

members.docComment:
/**
 * Data source adapter that provides and manages the list data.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * The data source is responsible for loading, filtering, sorting, and paginating data. It must implement the {@link DataSource} interface.
 */
members.name: dataSource

members.docComment:
/**
 * Column definitions that specify which fields to display and how to render them.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * Each field schema defines a column in the list, including its accessor, label, rendering behavior, and whether it supports filtering or sorting. {@link FieldSchema}
 */
members.name: fields

members.docComment:
/**
 * General (toolbar-level) actions that operate on the entire list or selected rows.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * These actions typically appear in the list toolbar and can operate on the current selection or the entire dataset. Examples include bulk delete, export, or refresh. {@link GeneralAction}
 */
members.name: generalActions

members.docComment:
/**
 * Property name on TRow that serves as the unique identifier for each row.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * This key is used for row selection, tracking, and uniquely identifying rows in operations like updates and deletions.
 */
members.name: idKey

members.docComment:
/**
 * Initial filters to apply when the list is first rendered.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * Specifies the initial state of active filters. Users can modify these filters through the UI, and the list will update accordingly. {@link ActiveFilterState}
 */
members.name: initialFilters

members.docComment:
/**
 * Initial pagination state including page size and starting page.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * Specifies the initial page number and number of rows per page. Users can navigate through pages and change the page size through the UI. {@link PaginationState}
 */
members.name: initialPagination

members.docComment:
/**
 * Initial sort configuration to apply when the list is first rendered.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * Defines which field to sort by and the sort direction (ascending or descending). Users can change the sort order through the UI. {@link SortDescriptor}
 */
members.name: initialSort

members.docComment:
/**
 * Row-level actions that operate on individual rows.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * These actions are associated with specific rows and typically appear as buttons or menu items in each row. Examples include edit, delete, or view details. {@link RowAction}
 */
members.name: rowActions

members.docComment:
/**
 * Selection mode that determines how rows can be selected in the list.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * Controls whether users can select no rows, a single row, or multiple rows. This affects the rendering of selection UI elements like checkboxes or radio buttons.
 */
members.name: selectionMode

members.docComment:
/**
 * High-level component that renders the entire ListDisplay experience using the core hook for state management and a set of slot-based components for the UI. Consumers can override any slot via the {@link ListConfig.components} map while still benefiting from the built-in behaviours.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * This component orchestrates the complete list UI including: - Toolbar with general actions - Filters panel for data filtering - Sort bar for column sorting - Table with rows and row actions - Pagination controls - Modal outlet for action confirmations - Loading, empty, and error states
 *
 * All sub-components can be replaced via the `components` prop while maintaining full integration with the core state management layer.
 *
 * @param props - Configuration object containing data source, fields, actions, and UI customization options. See {@link ListDisplayProps}.
 *
 * @returns A complete list UI with all interactive features enabled.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: ListDisplay

members.docComment:
/**
 * Props forwarded to {@link ListDisplay}. They mirror {@link ListConfig} and therefore describe the full data, schema, and action configuration for the list.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * This type is a direct alias to {@link ListConfig} with generic parameters set to `any`. It allows the list to work with any row type and row ID type. Consumers should provide appropriate configuration including data source, field schemas, actions, and optional component overrides.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: ListDisplayProps

members.docComment:
/**
 * Default modal outlet component for rendering action-triggered modals.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * This component provides default modal rendering functionality for list actions. It supports: - Confirm modals (ModalConfig.type === "confirm") with customizable titles, descriptions, and button labels - Fallback handling for missing action configurations - Custom modal placeholders with instructions for consumer implementation
 *
 * For custom modals (ModalConfig.type === "custom"), consumers are expected to override this component via the "ModalOutlet" slot in the list configuration and handle rendering themselves.
 *
 * @param props - The component props containing state, actions, and callbacks {@link ModalOutletProps}
 *
 * @returns A modal component based on the active action configuration, or null if no modal is open
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: ListModalOutlet

members.docComment:
/**
 * Exported snapshot of the list, meant to be consumed by the parent only on demand (not continuously controlled).
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: ListSnapshot
filters
pagination
rowsAll
rowsVisible
selection
sort
ModalConfig

members.docComment:
/**
 * Props forwarded to the modal outlet slot which orchestrates confirmation or custom modals associated with actions.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: ModalOutletProps
generalActions
onCancel
onConfirm
rowActions
state

members.docComment:
/**
 * Props for the pagination controls slot.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: PaginationProps
onChangePage
onChangePageSize
state

members.docComment:
/**
 * Pagination metadata describing both the current paging parameters and the total counts when known.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: PaginationState

members.docComment:
/**
 * Zero-based index of the current page.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * The first page is represented by index 0. This value is used to calculate which subset of rows should be displayed when pagination is enabled.
 */
members.name: pageIndex

members.docComment:
/**
 * Number of items requested per page.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * Defines how many rows should be displayed on each page. This value is used together with {@link PaginationState.pageIndex} to determine the visible row range.
 */
members.name: pageSize

members.docComment:
/**
 * Optional total number of items available across all pages.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * When provided, this value is used to calculate {@link PaginationState.totalPages} and enable UI features like page count display or jump-to-page controls. May be undefined when the total count is not yet known or not applicable.
 */
members.name: totalItems

members.docComment:
/**
 * Optional total number of pages inferred from {@link PaginationState.totalItems} and {@link PaginationState.pageSize}.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * Calculated as `Math.ceil(totalItems / pageSize)` when both values are available. May be undefined when {@link PaginationState.totalItems} is not provided or when the total page count cannot be determined.
 */
members.name: totalPages

members.docComment:
/**
 * Function type for loading data from a query source.
 *
 * @typeParam TRow - The type of individual row objects in the result set
 *
 * @returns A promise or synchronous result containing rows and optional total count
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: QueryLoadFn

members.docComment:
/**
 * Result object returned by a query load function.
 *
 * @typeParam TRow - The type of individual row objects in the result set
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: QueryResult
rows
totalCount

members.docComment:
/**
 * Configuration options for creating a query-based data source.
 *
 * @typeParam TRow - The type of individual row objects in the result set
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: QuerySourceOptions
label
load

members.docComment:
/**
 * Action that operates on a specific row in the list.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: RowAction
handler
RowActionContext
row
rowIndex

members.docComment:
/**
 * Identifier type accepted by selection helpers. Can be either a string or numeric value used to uniquely identify rows.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: RowId

members.docComment:
/**
 * Available selection modes for the list component. - `"none"`: No row selection allowed - `"single"`: Only one row can be selected at a time - `"multiple"`: Multiple rows can be selected simultaneously
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: SelectionMode_2

members.docComment:
/**
 * Tracks the current selection configuration and the ids that are selected.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: SelectionState
mode
selectedIds

members.docComment:
/**
 * Props for the sort bar slot. This surface exposes the fields that can be sorted alongside a handler to update the current sort descriptor.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: SortBarProps
fields
onChangeSort
state

members.docComment:
/**
 * Describes the active sort configuration for the list. Specifies which field to sort by and in which direction.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: SortDescriptor
direction
field

members.docComment:
/**
 * Direction used when sorting rows. - `"asc"` - Ascending order (A-Z, 0-9, oldest to newest) - `"desc"` - Descending order (Z-A, 9-0, newest to oldest)
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: SortDirection

members.docComment:
/**
 * Minimal props shared by the various status state components such as loading, empty, or error states.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: StatusStateProps
message

members.docComment:
/**
 * Result object returned by the bootstrap function of a streaming data source. Contains optional initial data and metadata for the stream.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: StreamBootstrapResult
initialRows
totalCount

members.docComment:
/**
 * Configuration options for creating a streaming data source. Defines how to bootstrap, subscribe to, refresh, and destroy a streaming connection.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: StreamSourceOptions
bootstrap
destroy
label
refresh
subscribe

members.docComment:
/**
 * Function type for subscribing to streaming data updates. Receives a patch listener and returns an optional unsubscribe function.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: StreamSubscribeFn

members.docComment:
/**
 * Props for the table slot responsible for rendering the visible rows.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: TableProps
fields
idKey
onRowActionClick
rowActions
state

members.docComment:
/**
 * Props passed to the toolbar slot component. This surface focuses on triggering list-level actions and therefore exposes the current list state and the available general actions.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: ToolbarProps
generalActions
onActionClick
state

members.docComment:
/**
 * Function returned by subscribe() that can be called to unsubscribe from data updates.
 *

members.name: Unsubscribe
